channel.title: Two axoloti's in 360°
channel.description:
I've been thinking of the most expressive and portable setup I can make with my different Axo boxes. I find that two axo's and a few controllers is the best combination. Here are a few videos of such setups. It all fits in a sports bag (with audio and video recording equipment and my small roland mobile cube) and a guitar sac (for the ribbon synth) The other setup is my double axo keyboard, which is a bit bigger, but has a nice 61 full size keyboard.
These videos explore using one axo as a 5 track delay machine (and short reverb) and using the other as the sound source, with patch changing and things.
I'm testing 360° videos too (put at highest resolution to try and see something), saves me having to think where to aim the camera :)
https://youtu.be/xmwfQ-zb9P4
https://youtu.be/TDbX5UGvNd8
https://youtu.be/iwCNwLegX-A
https://youtu.be/QHKoPcW44us

item.title: Two axoloti's in 360°
item.dc:creator: @Makrotulpa Lloyd W Barrett
item.description:
@Makrotulpa wrote:

I love the use of 3D for these kinda duets - feel like more of a participant somehow.

Read full topic

item.title: Two axoloti's in 360°
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

Last week-end, I met up with my friend for who I made my second axoloti box. I told him to bring it with him, and decided to jam out for a few tracks.
The funny thing is that my friends box still has the 6 same patches I made for it (he's only using one here), and hasn't been updated. He needed to sell some stuff before getting a new computer and start working on the software side.
But he has been using it non stop ever since I gave it to him (mixed with all his other stuff).

Otherwise I have been feeding my youtube channel with performances using mainly the axoloti, so dig in if you want more (or different). And tonight I'm doing a sold out gig with a noise / math rock band playing an organ patch only using the axoloti

Read full topic
